Class Coord

java.lang.Object
tetrisgame.Coord
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Coord extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a coordinate point on a grid

  • Constructor Details

    • Coord

      public Coord(int xX, int yY)
      Creates a coordinate point with specified x and y values. Both x and y are integers as we are on a grid, they correspond to column and row
      Parameters:
      xX - The x-coordinate.
      yY - The y-coordinate.

    • Coord

      public Coord(int[] vals)
      Creates a coordinate point from an array of two integers. This allows for increased compatibility with other code that might use a simple integer array to store grid coordinates. We just have to make sure the array has exactly two values.
      Parameters:
      vals - An array containing x and y values.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the array does not contain exactly two values.

    • Coord

      public Coord()
      Creates a coordinate point with default values (0, 0). Exists so we can use a default constructor and later set the coordinates.

  • Method Details

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Makes the private x-coordinate gettable from the outside
      Returns:
      The x-coordinate.

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Makes the private y-coordinate gettable from the outside
      Returns:
      The y-coordinate.

    • setX

      public void setX(int X)
      Sets the x-coordinate to a specified value
      Parameters:
      X - The new x-coordinate value.

    • setY

      public void setY(int Y)
      Sets the y-coordinate to a specified value
      Parameters:
      Y - The new y-coordinate value.

    • makeRelative

      public void makeRelative(Coord origin)
      Adjusts this coordinate to be relative to another coordinate. Could be useful for changing the origin of our grid, calculating distance etc.
      Parameters:
      origin - The origin coordinate to use as a reference.

    • flip

      public void flip()
      Swaps the x and y values of this coordinate. Allows for smoother rotation, mirroring etc. operations

    • toArray

      public int[] toArray()
      Converts this coordinate to an array representation. Exists to improve compatibility with integer array based grid coordinate representation.
      Returns:
      An array with the x and y values.

    • add

      public void add(Coord xy)
      Adds another coordinate's values to this coordinate.
      Parameters:
      xy - The coordinate to add.

    • pushX

      public void pushX(int off)
      Increases the x-coordinate by the specified offset. Useful so when moving the point in the given direction, so we don't have to use setX(getX()+offset).
      Parameters:
      off - The amount to increase the x-coordinate.

    • pushY

      public void pushY(int off)
      Increases the y-coordinate by the specified offset. Similiarly to pushX
      Parameters:
      off - The amount to increase the y-coordinate.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Compares this coordinate with another object for equality. Useful for testing Coord equality without manually comparing both x and y.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - The object to compare.
      Returns:
      True if the object is a Coord with the same x and y values; false otherwise.
